id: What is Makar Sankranti
text: Makar Sankranti marks the sun's transition into Capricorn It is celebrated with kite flying and sweets made from sesame and jaggery mainly in North India

id: Tell me about Vishu
text: Vishu is a festival celebrated in Kerala in April People wear new clothes light lamps and prepare Vishu Kani to welcome the new year

id: What is Chhath Puja
text: Chhath Puja is celebrated in Bihar Jharkhand and Uttar Pradesh People worship the Sun God offer prayers at riverbanks and observe fasts for prosperity

id: Tell me about Guru Nanak Jayanti
text: Guru Nanak Jayanti celebrates the birth of Guru Nanak Dev Ji People visit Gurudwaras sing hymns and share community meals called Langar

id: What is Independence Day in India
text: Independence Day is celebrated on August 15 People hoist the national flag watch parades and remember freedom fighters

id: Tell me about Republic Day in India
text: Republic Day is celebrated on January 26 It marks the adoption of the Indian Constitution People watch parades and cultural events in the capital and across the country

id: When is Independence Day in India
text: Independence Day is celebrated on August 15 every year It marks the day India became free from British rule in 1947

id: What happens on Independence Day
text: On Independence Day people hoist the national flag attend parades and cultural programs and remember freedom fighters

id: Tell me about Republic Day
text: Republic Day is celebrated on January 26 It marks the day the Indian Constitution came into effect in 1950

id: What is the main event on Republic Day
text: The main event is the grand parade in New Delhi which showcases India's military strength cultural diversity and achievements

id: Why do we celebrate Gandhi Jayanti
text: Gandhi Jayanti on October 2 celebrates the birth of Mahatma Gandhi It is observed with prayers, tributes, and promoting nonviolence and peace

id: Tell me about Flag Day
text: Flag Day is celebrated on December 7 to honor the Indian national flag People contribute to welfare funds for armed forces and veterans

id: What is National Youth Day
text: National Youth Day is celebrated on January 12 in honor of Swami Vivekananda's birth It inspires young people to work for the nation's progress

id: Tell me about Armed Forces Flag Day
text: Armed Forces Flag Day is observed on December 7 People contribute to welfare funds and pay respect to soldiers who protect the country

id: When is Constitution Day in India
text: Constitution Day is celebrated on November 26 It marks the adoption of the Indian Constitution in 1949

id: Why is National Education Day celebrated
text: National Education Day is celebrated on November 11 to honor Maulana Abul Kalam Azad It promotes awareness about the importance of education

id: Tell me about National Science Day
text: National Science Day is celebrated on February 28 to mark the discovery of the Raman Effect It encourages scientific thinking and innovation

id: What is National Voters Day
text: National Voters Day is celebrated on January 25 to encourage eligible citizens to vote and participate in democracy

id: When is New Year's Day in India
text: New Year's Day is celebrated on January 1 every year It marks the start of the new year

id: When is National Youth Day
text: National Youth Day is celebrated on January 12 in honor of Swami Vivekananda's birth It inspires young people to work for the nation's progress

id: When is Republic Day
text: Republic Day is celebrated on January 26 It marks the day the Indian Constitution came into effect in 1950

id: When is World Cancer Day
text: World Cancer Day is observed on February 4 to raise awareness about cancer prevention and treatment

id: When is National Science Day
text: National Science Day is celebrated on February 28 to mark the discovery of the Raman Effect It encourages scientific thinking and innovation

id: When is International Women's Day
text: International Women's Day is celebrated on March 8 to honor the achievements of women and promote gender equality

id: When is World Earth Day
text: World Earth Day is celebrated on April 22 to raise awareness about environmental protection and sustainability

id: When is Labor Day in India
text: Labor Day is celebrated on May 1 It honors the contribution of workers and laborers to the nation

id: When is Mother's Day
text: Mother's Day is celebrated on the second Sunday of May to honor mothers and their contributions

id: When is World Environment Day
text: World Environment Day is celebrated on June 5 to raise awareness about environmental issues and conservation

id: When is International Yoga Day
text: International Yoga Day is celebrated on June 21 to promote yoga, health, and well-being

id: When is Independence Day
text: Independence Day is celebrated on August 15 to mark India's freedom from British rule in 1947

id: When is Raksha Bandhan
text: Raksha Bandhan is a festival celebrating the bond between brothers and sisters It usually falls in August

id: When is Teachers' Day
text: Teachers' Day is celebrated on September 5 in honor of Dr Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan It celebrates the contributions of teachers

id: When is Gandhi Jayanti
text: Gandhi Jayanti is celebrated on October 2 to honor the birth of Mahatma Gandhi It promotes nonviolence and peace

id: When is Dussehra
text: Dussehra is celebrated in October It marks the victory of good over evil and the triumph of Lord Rama over Ravana

id: When is Diwali
text: Diwali is celebrated in October or November It is the festival of lights celebrating the victory of light over darkness

id: When is Children's Day
text: Children's Day is celebrated on November 14 to honor the birth of Jawaharlal Nehru It celebrates the welfare of children

id: When is National Constitution Day
text: Constitution Day is celebrated on November 26 It marks the adoption of the Indian Constitution in 1949

id: When is Christmas
text: Christmas is celebrated on December 25 It celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ and is observed with joy and festivities

id: When is Armed Forces Flag Day
text: Armed Forces Flag Day is observed on December 7 People contribute to welfare funds for armed forces and veterans

id: Hi!
text: What is your favorite holiday?

id: one where I get to meet lots of different people.
text: What was the most number of people you have ever met during a holiday?

id: Hard to keep a count. Maybe 25.
text: Which holiday was that?

id: I think it was Australia
text: Do you still talk to the people you met?

id: Not really. The interactions are usually short-lived but it's fascinating to learn where people are coming from and what matters to them
text: Yea, me too. I feel like God often puts strangers in front of you, and gives you an opportunity to connect with them in that moment in deeply meaningful ways. Do you ever feel like you know things about strangers without them telling you?

id: what do you mean?
text: I think it's like a 6th sense, often seen as "cold readings" to people, but can be remarkably accurate. I once sat next to a man in a coffee and I felt a pain in my back. I asked the stranger if he had a pain. It turns out that he did in the exact spot, and said he pulled a muscle while dancing at a party. I had never met the man before and never saw him again.

id: Wow! That's interesting, borderline spooky
text: There's this practice called "Treasure Hunting" that's kind of a fun game you play in a public place. There's a book called "The Ultimate Treasure Hunt" that talks about it. You use your creativity to imagine people you will meet, and you write down a description, then you associate them with a positive message or encouraging word. Maybe you saw a teenage boy in a red hat at the shopping mall in your imagination, then while at the mall, you may find someone who matches that description. You show that you have a message for him and that you have a message for a boy in a red hat. You then give him a message of kindness or whatever was on your heart. You have no idea, sometimes you meet someone who is having a really hard day, and it brings them to tears to have a stranger show them love.

id: So, do you do treasure hunting often?
text: I did more when I was in grad school (and had more time). I would usually go with friends. For a while I would go to the farmers market in Santa Cruz every week and try to feel if there is something I am supposed to tell a stranger. Usually, they are vague hope-filled messages, but it's weird when I blurt out something oddly specific.

Hi!

id: Oh hello. Long time no talk. How's the day going for yuo?
text: Very well, thanks for asking. How has your day been?

id: Getting better. I just recovered from a cold. I got wet in the rain last week. Are you planning anything for the holidays?
text: Glad to hear you're better. Sorry to hear you were sick. I was sick a couple of weeks ago with a bad cough. There's definitely a bug going around. Admit I just want to stay healthy for the holidays and plan to relax.

id: Oh same here. I think relaxing at home should be counted among the best ways to enjoy the holidays.
text: Definitely! I know a lot of folks travel for the holidays, but I'm happy to stay home myself!

id: I'm getting there. Every year until last year, I tried to go somewhere for the Christmas / New Year, and then I got bored traveling. lol not sure if that means I'm getting old?
text: Me too. Now I have folks come visit me for the holidays! But that's also tiresome..

id: Are you doing any home decorating then?
text: Yes! We set up an eco-friendly (i.e. fake) Christmas tree and put up some colorful LED lights which is very festive.

id: I think I'm copying you. Me and my wife plan to decorate and Christmas tree too. We bought most of the decorative stuffs from the stores, but haven't yet to buy the tree.
text: Buying a tree is a neat experience. I was torn between buying an artificial/eco-friendly/fake one vs. a real one that smells like fresh pine. In the end, we opted for the one that we can disassemble every year.

id: I see. Artificial anything is better, from tree to intelligence, huh?
text: Oh, very clever pun! I like it! Depends. I remember having real Christmas trees from childhood, but these days with climate change, I think not chopping down a tree just to decorate it and then throw it out in a month is the more responsible thing to do.

id: I see. It's probably also cheaper. I'll buy an artificial one too. Do you have any suggestions for the store?
text: Admit my favorite store is Target, plus they often have good deals.

id: Ah that's great. My wife also likes Target a lot. She even made a Target credit card because she comes to that store very often. Okay thanks for the suggestion. I'll check out Target.
text: Great, I hope you find a nice tree.

id: Oh, it's not research! Just a personal theory. I think that flower preferences are more revealing of personality than people appreciate.
text: Interesting! Whats your favorite flower?

id: The gerbera. It's like a cartoon flower. As if you drew "flower" with a crayon and then it came to life.
text: Nice, i would love know more about your theory. Like how you can deduce personality from flower preference.

id: Ok, step 1 is, you ask someone what their favourite flower is. Pretty much like what we just did. Does that make sense so far?
text: yes

id: Cool. Step 2: talk with the person some more, and ask them some more questions, and gradually develop a sense of what they're like, over the course of maybe two to five years. And voila

id: Why thank you, that's a wonderful idea!
